1.q_string:
Which of the following are examples of amphiprotic species?
1. H2CO3
2. HCO3-
3. H2O
4. H2SO4
5. HNO3

Directions: Match Column–I with Column–II and indicate your answer by selecting the appropriate option.

Column–I Column–II
(A) Aqueous solution of sodium acetate (a) More soluble in KNO3 than in water
(B) AgI (b) Half neutralised weak acid
(C) Titration of NH3 solution with HCl (c) pH > 7
(D) Maximum buffer capacity (d) Methyl orange indicator

q_option: If 0.1 mol of solid NaOH is added to the solution at constant volume, then the pH will change to 12.00.
Addition of NaOH decreases the dissociation of NH<sub>3</sub>.
1.q_string: When 0.1 mol of NH<sub>3</sub> is dissolved in sufficient water to make 1 L of solution, the solution is found to have a hydroxide ion concentration of 1.33 x<sup> </sup>10<sup>-3</sup> M. Which of the following statements is wrong?

(iii) Ammonia and ammonium chloride in water
